p: The way in which the strategies and disordered implementation of research have unfolded during this epidemic emergence, and the weight of research in the fight against COVID-19 (cf. decision-making in public policy) reinforce the previous recommendations of the National Academy of Medicine on the merits of coordination combining programming, evaluation, implementation, monitoring, European and international policy, innovation and communication and education [4]. The lack of coordination and the multiplication of small trials make it difficult to recruit and delay recruitment in larger trials and thus diminishes the prospect of usable results.
